electronic_commerce_indicator.description: This field must be completed with the result of the ECI field provided by the 3d Secure service. The Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) informs the card issuer if the transaction was protected by a security protocol like VbV or MCSC. It is mandated by Visa and MasterCard that all 3-D Secure transactions have this value populated in the authorization request. (Min: 0, max: 2).

cryptogram.description: This field must be completed with the result of the cryptogram field provided by the 3DSecure service. In Visa transactions, it represents the Cardholder Authentication Verification Value (CAVV), a cryptographic value generated by the Issuer as evidence of payment authentication during online purchase to qualify for chargeback protection. MasterCard transactions have a similar value called Accountholder Authentication Value (AAV) or the Universal Cardholder Authentication Field (UCAF). When submitting a transaction for authorization, the merchant must include the CAVV or AAV/UCAF to demonstrate that the cardholder has been authenticated. It is typically base64-encoded. (Min: 0, Max: 40).

transaction_id.description: For 3DS v1: This is the Unique Transaction Identifier. It is automatically generated by the MPI. It is typically 28 bytes in length and base64-encoded. Is commonly referred to as XID. (Min: 0, Max: 40). For 3DS v2: Universally unique transaction identifier assigned by the DS to identify a single transaction. (Min: 36, Max:36).

gender.description: The customer's gender (MAX 1; MIN 1; (M=Male/F=Female/NA=Not applicable/NK=Not Known)).

date_of_birth.description: The customer's date of birth in the YYYY-MM-DD format (Length: 10).

device_fingerprint.description: The customer's device fingerprint (MAX 4000; MIN 1). For integrations using Yuno checkout the value is obtained automatically, do not send this field.

accept_header.description: The accept header value of the customer's browser.

color_depth.description: The color depth of the customer's browser in bits per pixel. This should be obtained by using the browser's screen.colorDepth property. Accepted values: 1, 4, 8, 15, 16, 24, 30, 32 or 48 bit color depth. (MAX 5; MIN 1).

javascript_enabled.description: Indicates if Javascript is enabled or not in the device.

language.description: The navigator.language value of the customer's browser (as defined in IETF BCP 47) (MAX 5; MIN 1).

screen_height.description: The total height of the customer's device screen in pixels. (MAX 255; MIN 3).

screen_width.description: The total width of the customer's device screen in pixels. (MAX 255; MIN 3).

user_agent.description: The user agent value of the customer's browser (MAX 255; MIN 3).

document.description: Specifies the customer's document object, including its number and type.

phone.description: Specifies the customer's phone object, including number and code.

country_code.description: The country calling code of the phone (MAX 3; MIN 1).  Check the [Country reference](country-reference) to see the phone codes.

number.description: The phone number, without the country code (MAX 32; MIN 1).

billing_address.description: Specifies the customer's billing address object.

city.description: The city considered for the address (MAX 255; MIN 3).

state.description: The state/province from the address (MAX 255; MIN 3).

zip_code.description: The zipcode for the address (MAX 11; MIN 4).

city.description: The city considered for the address (MAX 255; MIN 3).

state.description: The state/province from the address (MAX 255; MIN 3).

additional_data.description: Specifies the additional_data object. This object is not mandatory. However, if you send this information, the payment experience will be enhanced for your user.

shipping_amount.description: The shipping amount of the order (multiple of 0.0001)

fee_amount.description: The fee amount of the order (multiple of 0.0001)

items.description: Specifies the items array of object.

id.description: The unique identifier of the item (MAX 255; MIN 1).

name.description: The name of the item (MAX 255; MIN 3).

unit_amount.description: The unit amount of the item (multiple of 0.0001).

category.description: The category of the item. Check the Item category reference.

brand.description: The brand of the item (MAX 255; MIN 1).

sku_code.description: The stock keeping unit (SKU) of the item (MAX 255; MIN 1).

manufacture_part_number.description: The manufacture part number of the item (MAX 255; MIN 1).

picture_url.description: The picture of the item (MAX 255; MIN 3)

departure_datetime.description: The departure date and time in UTC time (ISO 8601, MAX 27; MIN 27).

arrival_airport.description: IATA airport code. See http://www.iata.org (MAX 3; MIN 3).

carrier_code.description: IATA carrier code. See http://www.iata.org (MAX 2; MIN 2).

flight_number.description: The flight number assigned by the airline carrier (MAX 11; MIN 1).

fare_basis_code.description: Code base rate provides specific information on the fare in addition to the class service, both required for booking (MAX 15; MIN 1).

fare_class_code.description: The fare class code of the airline (MAX 1; MIN 1). The values can be a letter (A-Z) but may vary depending on the airline's definition. Check the [Airline information reference](airline-information#fare-class-code).

base_fare.description: The transaction amount, excluding taxes and fees, the smallest unit of currency (multipleOf 0.0001).

base_fare_currency.description: The currency used to transaction amount (MAX 3; MIN 3).

stopover_code.description: 1-letter code that indicates whether the passenger is allowed to make a stopover. Only two types of characters are allowed: O: Stopover allowed (the letter “O”, not zero) / X: Stopover not allowed. (MAX 1; MIN 1).

seller_details.description: Specifies the seller's details object. Only mandatory for PSPs with sub_merchant account information.

industry.description: The seller's industry (MAX 255; MIN 3; Industry category reference).

document.description: Specifies the document object of the seller.

phone.description: Specifies the seller's phone number object.

tax_base.description: The amount base to apply the tax defined.

id.description: The unique identifier of the transaction (MAX 64; MIN 36).

category.description: The category of the payment method used in the transaction.

provider_id.description: The id of the provider that processed the transaction.

payment_method.description: Specifies the payment method details used in the transaction.

vaulted_token.description: The vaulted_token represents a securely stored payment_method associated with a previous transaction. When utilizing a vaulted_token for creating a payment, there is no need to send an additional token; it can be set as null (MAX: 64; MIN: 36).

type.description: Payment method type. Mandatory for DIRECT or REDIRECT workflow.

vault_on_success.description: Flag to enroll the card after a successful payment.

token.description: The one time use payment method token provided by Yuno sdk. If a payment is created using a token, it is not necessary to send a vaulted_token as well, it can be defined as null. Not necessary for back to back payments (MAX: 64; MIN: 36).

payment_method_detail.description: Specifies the payment method detail object, which provides details of the different transaction category types that are part of the payment method object.

card.description: Specifies the details of the payment method when using a card.

verify.description: Using amount = 0 and verify = true, you can verify the user's card without authorizing a real amount.

capture.description: Decides whether to authorize the payment or capture it. Authorizing a card payment allows you to reserve funds in a customer's bank account.

first_installments_deferral.description: Number of months to wait to debit the first installment.

installments_amount.description: The installment amount includes interests associated with the installment and the information is defined by the provider.

version.description: Refers to the protocol version of the EMV 3-D Secure

electronic_commerce_indicator.description: This field must be completed with the result of the ECI field provided by the 3d Secure service. The Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) informs the card issuer if the transaction was protected by a security protocol like VbV or MCSC. It is mandated by Visa and MasterCard that all 3-D Secure transactions have this value populated in the authorization request. (Min: 0, max: 2).

cryptogram.description: This field must be completed with the result of the cryptogram field provided by the 3DSecure service. In Visa transactions, it represents the Cardholder Authentication Verification Value (CAVV), a cryptographic value generated by the Issuer as evidence of payment authentication during online purchase to qualify for chargeback protection. MasterCard transactions have a similar value called Accountholder Authentication Value (AAV) or the Universal Cardholder Authentication Field (UCAF). When submitting a transaction for authorization, the merchant must include the CAVV or AAV/UCAF to demonstrate that the cardholder has been authenticated. It is typically base64-encoded. (Min: 0, Max: 40).

transaction_id.description: For 3DS v1: This is the Unique Transaction Identifier. It is automatically generated by the MPI. It is typically 28 bytes in length and base64-encoded. Is commonly referred to as XID. (Min: 0, Max: 40). For 3DS v2: Universally unique transaction identifier assigned by the DS to identify a single transaction. (Min: 36, Max:36).

parameters.name: payout_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payout (MAX 64 ; MIN 36).

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payment from the provider (MAX 64 ; MIN 36).

type.description: The type of the report to run (MAX 255; MIN 3).

user_code.description: The unique identifier of the customer needed to generate the report (MAX 36; MIN 36).

start_date.description: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run (MAX 24; MIN 24; [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

end_date.description: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run (MAX 24; MIN 24; [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

merchant_reference_id.description: The unique identifier of the report at the merchant side (MAX 255; MIN 3).

account_id.description:
The unique identifier of the account (MAX 64 ; MIN 36). To request the creation of a report for all accounts, don't send this parameter. Otherwise indicate all the account_id you want to include.
Example: `19d28762-c714-4fb0-9ef6-4e1953ed33tf, 91d82267-c714-4fb0-9ef6-4e1953ed33tf`.

payment_status.description:
The status of the payment (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Payment status](ref:payment#payments-status)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all payment status. Otherwise, indicate all the status you want to include.
Example: `CREATED,READY_TO_PAY,DECLINED`

payment_sub_status.description:
The substatus of the payment (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Payment substatus](ref:payment#payments-status)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all payment sub status. Otherwise, indicate all the sub status you want to include.
Example: `READY_TO_PAY,PENDING_FRAUD_REVIEW,EXPIRED`

payment_method.description:
The type of payment method selected by the customer (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Payment methods](ref:payment-type-list)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all payment methods. Otherwise, indicate all the methods you want to include.
Example: `ADDI,ACUOTAZ,PIX`

currency.description:
The currency used to make the payment (MAX 3; MIN 3; [ISO 4217](ref:country-reference)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all currencies. Otherwise, indicate all currencies you want to include.
Example: `ARS,BRL,COP`

country.description:
The country where the transaction must be processed (MAX 2; MIN 2; [ISO 3166-1](ref:country-reference)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all countries. Otherwise, indicate all countries you want to include.
Example: `AR,BR,CO`

transaction_type.description:
The transaction type (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Transaction types](ref:transaction#types-of-transactions)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all transaction types. Otherwise, indicate all transaction types you want to include.
Example: `PURCHASE,REFUND,VERIFY`

transaction_status.description:
The status of the transaction (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Transaction status](ref:payment#payments-status)). Don't send this parameter to request the creation of a report for all transaction status. Otherwise, indicate all transaction status you want to include.
Example: `SUCCEEDED,CREATED,EXPIRED`

updated_at_start.description: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run by updated date of operation(MAX 27; MIN 27; [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

updated_at_end.description: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run by updated date of operation(MAX 27; MIN 27; [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

columns.description:
The columns to include in the report. **Use this parameter only for Payment or Transaction reports**. This option is not available for Settlement and Transaction reconciliation reports. Check the available comuns for each report on the [Report Fields](ref:reports-fields) page.
Example: `account_code,amount_value,card_category`

items.example: The merchant has no authorization to use this API.
